writingAnswer.referenceEssay:
**Proposal for Organizing a Speech Contest**

**Topic:** The Impact of Technology on Modern Society

**Aim:** The primary goal of this speech contest is to foster critical thinking and public speaking skills among students. By addressing the profound influence of technology on our lives, participants will gain a deeper understanding of contemporary issues and enhance their ability to articulate complex ideas effectively.

**Procedure:** The contest will be divided into three stages: preliminary rounds, semi-finals, and the final. In the preliminary rounds, participants will deliver a 3-minute speech on the given topic. The top 10 speakers will advance to the semi-finals, where they will present a 5-minute speech. Finally, the top 5 contestants will compete in the final round, delivering a 7-minute speech. A panel of judges, including faculty members and student representatives, will evaluate the speeches based on content, delivery, and originality.

**Selection of Contestants:** Any student interested in participating can register online. A preliminary screening will be conducted to ensure that all contestants meet the basic criteria of public speaking proficiency. The final selection will be based on the quality of speeches delivered during the preliminary rounds.

This contest aims to provide a platform for students to showcase their talents and engage in meaningful discussions about the role of technology in shaping our future.

translationAnswer.referenceTranslation: Dujiangyan, located on the Minjiang River in the western part of the Chengdu Plain, approximately 50 kilometers from Chengdu, was first constructed in the 3rd century BC. Its uniqueness lies in the fact that it does not require dams to regulate water flow. For over two millennia, Dujiangyan has effectively served both flood prevention and irrigation purposes, transforming the Chengdu Plain into a fertile land that ensures stable harvests despite droughts or floods, and making it one of China's most important grain-producing regions. The Dujiangyan project embodies the wisdom of the Chinese people in harmoniously coexisting with nature and stands as the world's oldest, continuously operational, and dam-free water management system.
